meanings.definition: A sudden, quick movement or jerk.
meanings.sent1: The cat made a bink and pounced on the toy.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bink in the bushes and thought it was a squirrel.
meanings.sent3: The bink of the door closing startled me.
meanings.sent4: His heart made a bink as he heard the unexpected news.
meanings.sent5: The bink of the falling book echoed in the room.

meanings.sent1: She tried to bink the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player binked the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally binked his toe on the table leg.
meanings.sent4: The boxer binked his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The chef binked the garlic cloves to release their flavor.

meanings.definition: A small, quick, or sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The bink of the glass shattering made everyone jump.
meanings.sent2: I heard a bink coming from the old clock on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The bink of the popcorn kernels bursting in the microwave was music to her ears.
meanings.sent4: The bink of the car horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: The bink of the typewriter keys filled the room with a rhythmic melody.
